data.title: Gallant specializes in private labels of ethically made organic cotton products.
data.meta_description: We help you transition to ethically made private labels of promotional apparel, uniforms, and fashion that are organically and regeneratively grown cotton & GOTS-certified.
data.meta_site_name: Private Label With Purpose. We craft socio-environmentally responsible promotional apparel, uniforms, and fashion one stitch at a time.
data.text:
For People and the Planet:

To lead the regenerative organic cotton movement in India, empowering farmers to earn more, lead healthier lives, combat climate change, and prevent farmer suicides. Our vision is for farmers to find joy and fulfillment in farming, reducing the need to abandon their land and migrate to cities. The scope of our work seeks to positively impact all people along the cotton supply chain, from farmers to factory workers to our partners.

Fourteen years of experience have taught us what it takes to make truly value-added products that have a positive impact on your business, the planet, and the entire supply chain, starting with farmers. This impact, in turn, influences the way your clients see you, and that is enriching for us all. Let’s make something good together.

Vikrant Giri (Vik) was born and raised in Pokhara, Nepal, and from a young age, he traveled extensively in India with his extended family. These journeys gave him first-hand insight into the harmful effects of conventional farming and the exploitation of laborers within supply chains. This unacceptable truth inspired Vik to start a purpose-driven company dedicated to making a positive impact on cotton farmers and workers across the entire supply chain. His mission includes championing the use of organic and regenerative organic cotton for the benefits it brings to both people and the planet. Vik believes that the best way to support his cutomers on their organic journey is by fostering direct relationships with farmers, offering full support and long-term commitment while prioritizing complete transparency and traceability, and providing measurable impact data.

CERTIFIED BCORP

We became a Certified B Corporation® because we believe that businesses are capable of doing more social and environmental good in society. The B Corp™ community is a group of companies who are, “leaders of a global movement of people using business as a force for good. They meet the highest standards of overall social and environmental performance, transparency”.

To learn more about B Corp click HERE.

REGENERATIVE ORGANIC CERTIFIED

In 2021, we and our factory partners started working with our organic cotton co-op partner to transition more than 700 farmers to regenerative organic cotton. Currently, we are working with over 900 farmers in Odisha, India.

Currently, we are offering woven shirts, knitwear, bags, and accessories made with ROC™ cotton. What is ROC™?

GOTS CERTIFIED GOTS

All our products are made using 100% organic cotton. No toxic or harmful chemicals used during dyeing or printing process. No synthetic pesticides, fertilizers or genetically modified seeds.

To learn more click HERE.

FAIR TRADE CERTIFIED

Our products are made in factories that support fair trade standards. These are facilities where workers are paid fair wages, have safe working conditions, and get to decide how they wish to use the premiums from Fairtrade each year.

To learn more about Fair Trade, go here HERE & Fairtrade International click HERE.

RODALE INSTITUTE

Widely recognized as the birthplace of the organic movement in the US, Rodale Institute (RI) is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit dedicated to growing the regenerative organic agriculture movement through rigorous research, farmer training, and education. Its groundbreaking science and direct farmer-support programs serve as a catalyst for change in farming and food production worldwide. Over its 75-year history, Rodale Institute has proven that organic farming is not only viable but essential to humanity’s survival.

To learn more, click HERE

ORGANIC TRADE ASSOCIATION

The Organic Trade Association (OTA) is the membership-based business association for organic agriculture and products in North America. OTA is the leading voice for the organic trade in the United States, representing more than 500 organic businesses across 50 states and 9,500 producers through its Farmers Advisory Council.

To learn more, click HERE

TEXTILE EXCHANGE

Textile Exchange is a global non-profit driving beneficial impacts on climate and nature across the fashion, textile, and apparel industry. We guide a growing community of brands, manufacturers and farmers towards more purposeful production, right from the start of the supply chain.

To learn more, click HERE

FEEDING AMERICA

We are proud to be assisting Feeding America on its journey to end hunger. Feeding America is a nationwide network of 200 food banks that is leading the fight against hunger in the United States. Together, we provide food to more than 46 million people—including 12 million children and 7 million seniors—through 60,000 food pantries and meal programs in communities across America.

To learn more, click HERE.
